articles.description: One Direction star Payne, 31, died after falling from a hotel balcony in Argentina.
articles.title: Liam Payne: Three charged in connection with singer's death

articles.description: New inflation fears and poignant remarks by the Prince of Wales make Friday's front pages.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Reeves is driving up prices' and William's 'hardest year'

articles.description: The Prince of Wales tells reporters his year has been "dreadful", following a difficult year for the royals.
articles.title: William: Prince of Wales says its been hardest year of his life

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Susan McGowan from North Lanarkshire died two weeks after taking the drug tirzepatide, brand name Mounjaro.
articles.title: Nurse's death linked to weight-loss drug Mounjaro approved on NHS

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The FA opens a safeguarding inquiry into a Premier League club boss, a year on from a BBC report.
articles.title: FA to investigate Premier League club boss over alleged sexual offences

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Russian president also said that Trump's claim that he can help end the war in Ukraine "deserves attention at least".
articles.title: Vladimir Putin hails 'courageous' Donald Trump after election win

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The mass deportation of undocumented immigrants would face legal and practical challenges - and cost billions.
articles.title: How would Trump’s promise of mass deportations of migrants work?

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Officials in rural South Carolina say the female rhesus monkeys escaped into the wild after their pen was left open.
articles.title: Forty-three monkeys on the loose after escaping from US research lab

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Sir Jon Thompson tells a conference there is "no evidence high-speed trains interfere with bats".
articles.title: Bat safety shed will cost £100m, says HS2 chairman

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: John Smyth QC's abuse of more than 100 children and young men was covered up for years, a report concludes.
articles.title: John Smyth QC: Decades of abuse covered up by church, report says
